result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison R Mink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with any Wal-Mart store located in Washington County, WI.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with the co-defendant, Samantha Albert, except as allowed by probation agent.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty John P Kuczmarski.  Atty Mark D Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  State moves to amend charge to two counts of Misd Retail Theft PTC, 943.50(1m)(d)&(4)(a); Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 & Ct 2 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1 & Ct 2 as amended.  Statements from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Def in person & by Atty Perez Reyes for Atty John P Kuczmarski.  Atty Peter J Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Offer has been rec'd - counsel expects resolution.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
No contact with any Walmart Store in State of Wisconsin

Def appears in custody & w/Atty John Kuczmarski of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $1500 signature bond.  SPD will represent. Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 09:45 am.
